trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with CloudPassage | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with CloudPassage | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and CloudPassage.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and CloudPassage.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with CloudPassage
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with CloudPassage

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate CloudPassage with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).<html></html>Integrating CloudPassage with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show you how to integrate CloudPassage with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).<html></html>Integrating CloudPassage with Azure AD provides you with the following benefits:

trans-unit.source: You can control in Azure AD who has access to CloudPassage
trans-unit.target: You can control in Azure AD who has access to CloudPassage

trans-unit.source: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to CloudPassage (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts
trans-unit.target: You can enable your users to automatically get signed-on to CloudPassage (Single Sign-On) with their Azure AD accounts

trans-unit.source: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal
trans-unit.target: You can manage your accounts in one central location - the Azure Active Directory Portal

trans-unit.source: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see <link><linkText>What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to know more details about SaaS app integration with Azure AD, see <link><linkText>What is application access and single sign-on with Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD integration with CloudPassage, you need the following items:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD integration with CloudPassage, you need the following items:

trans-unit.source: An Azure AD subscription
trans-unit.target: An Azure AD subscription

trans-unit.source: A CloudPassage single-sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A CloudPassage single-sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, we do not recommend using a production environment.

trans-unit.source: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:
trans-unit.target: To test the steps in this tutorial, you should follow these recommendations:

trans-unit.source: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.
trans-unit.target: You should not use your production environment, unless this is necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure AD test environment, you can get a free one-month Azure trial subscription <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure AD test environment, you can get a free one-month Azure trial subscription <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Scenario Description
trans-unit.target: Scenario Description

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment. <html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to enable you to test Azure AD single sign-on in a test environment. <html></html>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of two main building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of two main building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Adding CloudPassage from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding CloudPassage from the gallery

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Adding CloudPassage from the gallery
trans-unit.target: Adding CloudPassage from the gallery

trans-unit.source: To configure the integration of CloudPassage into Azure AD, you need to add CloudPassage from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.
trans-unit.target: To configure the integration of CloudPassage into Azure AD, you need to add CloudPassage from the gallery to your list of managed SaaS apps.

trans-unit.source: To add CloudPassage from the gallery, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add CloudPassage from the gallery, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type CloudPassage.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type CloudPassage.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select CloudPassage, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select CloudPassage, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring and testing Azure AD single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with CloudPassage based on a test user called "Britta Simon".
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to show you how to configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with CloudPassage based on a test user called "Britta Simon".

trans-unit.source: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in CloudPassage to an user in Azure AD is. In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in CloudPassage needs to be established.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: For single sign-on to work, Azure AD needs to know what the counterpart user in CloudPassage to an user in Azure AD is. In other words, a link relationship between an Azure AD user and the related user in CloudPassage needs to be established.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the user name in Azure AD as the value of the Username in CloudPassage.
trans-unit.target: This link relationship is established by assigning the value of the user name in Azure AD as the value of the Username in CloudPassage.

trans-unit.source: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with CloudPassage, you need to complete the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: To configure and test Azure AD single sign-on with CloudPassage, you need to complete the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable your users to use this feature.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Configuring Azure AD Single Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable your users to use this feature.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Creating an Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Creating an Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to test Azure AD single sign-on with Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Creating a CloudPassage test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in CloudPassage that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Creating a CloudPassage test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to have a counterpart of Britta Simon in CloudPassage that is linked to the Azure AD representation of her.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Assigning the Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Assigning the Azure AD test user</linkText><title></title></link>** - to enable Britta Simon to use Azure AD single sign-on.

trans-unit.source: **<link><linkText>Testing Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to verify whether the configuration works.
trans-unit.target: **<link><linkText>Testing Single Sign-On</linkText><title></title></link>** - to verify whether the configuration works.

trans-unit.source: Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your CloudPassage application.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enable Azure AD single sign-on in the Azure AD portal and to configure single sign-on in your CloudPassage application.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: Your CloudPassage application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your SAML token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your CloudPassage application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your SAML token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with CloudPassage, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure AD single sign-on with CloudPassage, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the CloudPassage application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the Configure Single Sign-On dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the CloudPassage application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the Configure Single Sign-On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to CloudPassage page, select Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to CloudPassage page, select Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings dialog page, perform the following steps: Configure App Settings
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings dialog page, perform the following steps: Configure App Settings

trans-unit.source: In the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your CloudPassage app (e.g.: https://portal.cloudpassage.com/saml/init/accountid).
trans-unit.target: In the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your CloudPassage app (e.g.: https://portal.cloudpassage.com/saml/init/accountid).

trans-unit.source: In the Reply URL textbox, type your AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: https://portal.cloudpassage.com/saml/consume/accountid). You can get your value for this attribute by clicking SSO Setup documentation in the Single Sign-on Settings section of your CloudPassage portal. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: In the Reply URL textbox, type your AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: https://portal.cloudpassage.com/saml/consume/accountid). You can get your value for this attribute by clicking SSO Setup documentation in the Single Sign-on Settings section of your CloudPassage portal. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In a different browser window, sign-on to your CloudPassage company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different browser window, sign-on to your CloudPassage company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Settings, and then click Site Administration. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Settings, and then click Site Administration. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Click the Authentication Settings tab. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Click the Authentication Settings tab. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-on Settings section, perform the following steps: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-on Settings section, perform the following steps: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the SAML issuer URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the SAML issuer URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage dialog page, copy the Service Provider (SP) initiated endpoint value, and then paste it into the SAML endpoint URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage dialog page, copy the Service Provider (SP) initiated endpoint value, and then paste it into the SAML endpoint URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage dialog page, copy the Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout landing page textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at CloudPassage dialog page, copy the Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout landing page textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it into the x 509 certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it into the x 509 certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Next. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Next. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the Single sign-on confirmation page, click Complete. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: On the Single sign-on confirmation page, click Complete. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In the nu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: In the nu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: To add the required user attributes, for each row in the table below, perform the following steps: <html></html>
trans-unit.target: To add the required user attributes, for each row in the table below, perform the following steps: <html></html>

trans-unit.source: Attribute Name
trans-unit.target: Attribute Name

trans-unit.source: Attribute Value
trans-unit.target: Attribute Value

trans-unit.source: firstname
trans-unit.target: firstname

trans-unit.source: user.givenname
trans-unit.target: user.givenname

trans-unit.source: lastname
trans-unit.target: lastname

trans-unit.source: user.surname
trans-unit.target: user.surname

trans-unit.source: email
trans-unit.target: email

trans-unit.source: user.mail
trans-unit.target: user.mail

trans-unit.source: In the tollbar on the bottom, click Apply Changes. Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: In the tollbar on the bottom, click Apply Changes. Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.<html></html><html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a test user in the Azure portal called Britta Simon.<html></html><html></html>

trans-unit.source: In the Users list, select Britta Simon.Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: In the Users list, select Britta Simon.Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a test user in Azure AD, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating an Azure AD test user</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating an Azure AD test user</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click Users.Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: To display the list of users, in the menu on the top, click Users.Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: To open the Add User dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click Add User. Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: To open the Add User dialog, in the toolbar on the bottom, click Add User. Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: On the Tell us about this user dialog page, perform the following steps: Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: On the Tell us about this user dialog page, perform the following steps: Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.
trans-unit.target: As Type Of User, select New user in your organization.

trans-unit.source: In the User Name textbox, type BrittaSimon.
trans-unit.target: In the User Name textbox, type BrittaSimon.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the User Profile dialog page, perform the following steps: Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: On the User Profile dialog page, perform the following steps: Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.
trans-unit.target: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.

trans-unit.source: In the Last Name textbox, type, Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Last Name textbox, type, Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Display Name textbox, type Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Display Name textbox, type Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Role list, select User.
trans-unit.target: In the Role list, select User.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Get temporary password dialog page, click create.Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: On the Get temporary password dialog page, click create.Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: On the Get temporary password dialog page, perform the following steps:Creating an Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: On the Get temporary password dialog page, perform the following steps:Creating an Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: Write down the value of the New Password.
trans-unit.target: Write down the value of the New Password.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Creating a CloudPassage test user
trans-unit.target: Creating a CloudPassage test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in CloudPassage.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to create a user called Britta Simon in CloudPassage.

trans-unit.source: To create a user called Britta Simon in CloudPassage, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To create a user called Britta Simon in CloudPassage, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign-on to your CloudPassage company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign-on to your CloudPassage company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings, and then click Site Administration. Creating a CloudPassage test user
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Settings, and then click Site Administration. Creating a CloudPassage test user

trans-unit.source: Click the Users tab, and then click Add New User. Creating a CloudPassage test user
trans-unit.target: Click the Users tab, and then click Add New User. Creating a CloudPassage test user

trans-unit.source: In the Add New User section, perform the following steps: Creating a CloudPassage test user
trans-unit.target: In the Add New User section, perform the following steps: Creating a CloudPassage test user

trans-unit.source: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.
trans-unit.target: In the First Name textbox, type Britta.

trans-unit.source: In the Last Name textbox, type Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Last Name textbox, type Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the Username textbox, the Email textbox and the Retype Email textbox, type Britta's user name in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: In the Username textbox, the Email textbox and the Retype Email textbox, type Britta's user name in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: As Access Type, select Enable Halo Portal Access.
trans-unit.target: As Access Type, select Enable Halo Portal Access.

trans-unit.source: Click Add.
trans-unit.target: Click Add.

trans-unit.source: Assigning the Azure AD test user
trans-unit.target: Assigning the Azure AD test user

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to enable Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to CloudPassage.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to enable Britta Simon to use Azure single sign-on by granting her access to CloudPassage.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To assign Britta Simon to CloudPassage, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign Britta Simon to CloudPassage, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure portal, to open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the applications list, select CloudPassage.
trans-unit.target: In the applications list, select CloudPassage.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Users.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Users.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Users list, select Britta Simon.
trans-unit.target: In the Users list, select Britta Simon.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the bottom, click Assign.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the bottom, click Assign.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html><linkText>Assign User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Testing Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Testing Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to test your Azure AD single sign-on configuration using the Access Panel.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: When you click the CloudPassage tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your CloudPassage application.
trans-unit.target: When you click the CloudPassage tile in the Access Panel, you should get automatically signed-on to your CloudPassage application.
